venue.name: Camels Hump Road (Burrows Trail Trailhead Parking Lot)

item.description:
*** IMPORTANT*************************

Please read entire event description before you sign up.  When you sign up, you'll be asked several questions.  Answering questions is NOT an option during your RSVP process on my hiking event.  If you omit it, you'll be eventually moved out from "On-Going" list by the event organizer. [Only exception is that if you think I hiked with you already in past and you know about your hiking experience, you may not have to answer to my questions. ]  You'll receive reminder to answer to the questions through e-mail in advance. 

**************************************

I'm planning to hike Camel's Hump(4083 ft), one of 5 4K footers in VT on 10/22(Sat).

 

I've done Camel's Hump hike from East and West side, however, I haven't done from North side.  So let's try it out....from Bamforth Ridge (Long Trail).  I hope to see beautiful foliage view on the way to Camel's Hump.

 

Hiking Route & Description:

* We meet at Burrows Trail (Side Trail of LT) Large Parking Lot at the end of Camels Hump Road in Huntington, VT at 9:30AM.    We leave some cars here for car spotting and drive to Long Trail parking area on Duxbury Rd, Richmond.  This is North Side of Camel's Hump.

* After we reach to the parking area on Duxbury Rd, we'll start hiking within 10-15min.  So please be prepared. 

* Hike on Long Trail via Bamforth Ridge about 6.4 miles to reach Camel's Hump summit.

* Eat lunch and take a break, then, hike out on Burrows Trail approx. 2.4 miles or so.

* This is approx. 8.8 miles Traverse Hike. I'll hike with slow to moderate pace (1.5-2 mph pace) but will spend enough time to take a break or take some pix on the way to the summit.   This is my usual hike as I take a lot of pictures. 

 

Rules to follow:

* Please don't bring your friends who are NOT the member of this meetup group as I need to make sure liability as well as hikers capability who are going to join my hike in advance.

 

Weather Check Point:

Weather check point will be done on Oct 21st (Fri), 7PM. 

 

 Note:  At the higher elevation, temp might be colder than you assume.  Please don't underestimate the cold weather in higher elevation and make sure to bring appropriate gear such as waterproof/windproof jacket (in case of rain) etc.   Please bring enough water, snack and lunch. Also bring First Aid Kit for your use.  I carry gear for my use.  Needless to say, please don't forget to bring your headlamp, although I'd like to come back to the parking lot before getting dark.

If you have any questions, please feel free to drop me an email.

 

Assistant Organizer,

Tomoko

 

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: My Car is Honda CR-V(Blue, VT plate)
item.name: VT/Camel's Hump(4083 ft) Hike via Bamforth Ridge(Long Trail)
